column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given the Iron Sucrose Injection all at once. It was given in an Iv. It took a total of 3 hours. A few days after the Iv I felt like every bone in my body ached. My joints were stiff and ached. I had terrible headaches. I ran a fever of about 101. I live in a resort town and this happened  Labor Day weekend and we were short of help. I worked but I thought I was going to die. I have no idea how I made it through. I seriously don't remember much of the month of September. All I remember is how bad I felt. I don't know the dose I received in the Iv but from reading on this site it looks like the Iron Sucrose is usually given over a few days. I'm wondering now if I was given this Iron to quickly. I think my research has just begun.

column2: mominne, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Wk 3 of 8 wk IV treatment.  Cramping and diarrhea.  No appetite at all.  Excessive fatigue and insomnia.  Stopped chewing ice, though.

column9: after three infusions0f 100mgsand 821dollars no benifits were obtained from this drug

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm only on my second treatment, but it makes me really tired, but I can't sleep. I'm also nauseated most of the time, with absolutely no apatite.

column2: Dee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had to have IV's of this iron for 5 weeks, It made my hair fall out, both of my arms hurt bad for weeks, and made me very tired for months, bad taste in my mouth, during IV, bowl trouble. I am more tired now then I was when my blood level was down to 6.0. I had surgery june 2009 that I had internal bleeding, but I was getting back up with iron then i started having bad female problems and my ob/gyn wouldn't help me stop bleeding(bleed for 7month) so my blood got down to 7.2. So thats why I had to take the treatments.

column9: I have had 250ml once a week for the last 2 then it is 1per mnth for the next 12. I am concerned with the side effects. Have not been feeling the best since I started. I have alot of bloating, gas, lethargic, diarrhea, abdominal cramping and depression

column2: DARDAR, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I ALSO HAD A ALLERGIC REACTION TO THIS MED.BUT MY DR. WAS ABLE TO GIVE BENADRYL12.5 MG  INJECTION,TYLENOL 1000MG BY MOUTH,ATIVAN 0.5 MG IV,SOLUMEDROL 60 MG,IV.AND THE VENOFER 200MG. IT HAS BEEN THE ONLY SOLUTION TO MY ANEMIA.IT'S A FIVE DAY PROCEESE AND MAKES YOU VERY DROWSY,BUT IT WORKS.
